content_block.no_contents: Specify a text to <1>fix this block</1>.
content_block.no_activity: No activity has been recorded for this project. This warning will disappear once there is project activity.
content_block.no_markdown: Add Markdown content to <1>fix this block</1>.
content_block.no_texts: <0>Add texts to the project</0> or <2>adjust the block configuration</2> to fix this block.
content_block.no_resources: Add <1>resources</1> or <3>resource collections</3>to the project to fix this block.
content_block.no_metadata: <0>Add project metadata</0> to fix this block.

video_playback.heading: Unable to play video.
video_playback.body: Your browser is not able to play this video.
video_playback.download: You may download it and play it locally using the download button below.

errors.audio_playback: {{ error }}<1/>This audio file is not playable in your browser.<3/><4/>Click the download button to listen to the file on your device.

unauthorized.heading: Access Denied
unauthorized.body: You must be logged in to manage notification preferences.

errors.no_collapse_context: Collapse components cannot be rendered outside the Collapse wrapper component.

reading_group.customize: <0>Ready to customize your group?</0><1>Congratulations, you’ve created a Reading Group. Now you can begin adding content, editing the order, grouping, and descriptions on your home page, and sending out invitations for new members.</1><2>Start adding content:</2><3>Reading Groups can contain a variety of content: Projects, Texts, Text Sections, Resource Collections, and individual Resources can all be added to your group. To find and add content, you can either browse the library or use keyword search. Once you’ve found an item you wish to add, simply select the star icon and assign it to this group (or any other Reading Group you are managing).</3>
reading_group.settings: <0>Edit settings and invite members:</0><1>You can edit the settings for your group at any time. Change your group’s name, privacy settings, or email notifications. You can also see your group’s invitation code, or use an invitation URL, which makes inviting members as easy as sharing its invitation web page address.</1>

placeholders.table_of_contents: This text does not have a table of contents.

my_starred.title: You haven’t starred any items … yet.
my_starred.body: But don’t fret, we’ve made it easy. Anywhere you see an empty star icon, just select it to add that item to your collection. You can star all kinds of items, so start browsing projects and get starring!
my_starred.animation_label: A grid of tiles with star icons that fade in.

annotations_filtered.title: No annotations matched your search criteria.
annotations_filtered.body: Try removing the text or member filter above to see more annotations.

no_user.title: This group doesn‘t have any annotations yet.
no_user.body: Sign up or log in, then join this group and be the first member to create an annotation!

user_not_member.title: This group doesn‘t have any annotations yet.
user_not_member.body: Join and be the first member to create an annotation! While reading, you can associate a new or existing annotation with this group.

user_is_member.title: Be the first reader to annotate in this group!
user_is_member.body: While reading, you can associate a new or existing annotation with this group.

annotations_my.title: Create your first annotation!
annotations_my.body: While reading, add your notes and annotations to the text. Save them privately, or associate them with a reading group.

authorized.title: Oh no. There are no journal issues in this Manifold library.
authorized.body: But it’s easy to create new issues with Manifold. If you have backend access, <2>head to the backend</2> and first select <4>Add a New Journal</4>. Once you’ve created a journal, you can add new issues to it, or turn existing projects into journal issues. For more help, you can learn about creating and publishing Manifold Issues in <6>our documentation</6>.

unauthorized.title: There are no journal issues in this Manifold library.

authorized.title: Oh no. There are no journals in this Manifold library.
authorized.body: But it’s easy to create new journals with Manifold. If you have backend access, <2>head to the backend</2> and select <4>Add a New Journal</4>. For more help, you can learn about creating and publishing Manifold Issues in <7>our documentation</7>.

unauthorized.title: There are no journals in this Manifold library.

project_collections_admin.title: Ready to create a Project Collection?
project_collections_admin.body: With Project Collections, you can take control of what appears on your Manifold Library homepage. Create custom groupings of Projects and change their order and visibility. You can handpick your collections and order them manually, or you can create Smart Collections that automatically update based on your filtering criteria.

authorized.title: On no. This Manifold library is empty.
authorized.body: But it’s easy to create and publish projects with Manifold. If you have backend access, <1>head to the backend</1> and select <3>Add a New Project</3>. For more help, you can learn about creating and publishing Manifold Projects <5>here</5>.

authorized.title: Oh no. There are no project collections in this Manifold library.
authorized.body: But it’s easy to create new project collections with Manifold. If you have backend access, <3>head to the backend</3> and select <6>Add a New Project Collection</6>. For more help, you can learn about creating and publishing Manifold Project Collections <9>here</9>.

unauthorized.title: There are no project collections in this Manifold library.

no_user.title: This Manifold doesn’t have any reading groups yet.
no_user.body: Sign up or log in to create the first group, or learn more about reading groups in our documentation.

public.title: This Manifold doesn’t have any reading groups yet.
public.body: Be the first person to create one, or learn more about reading groups in our documentation.

user.title: Join a group, or create a new one.
user.body: To join a group, enter your group invitation code below. You can also create your own group, or learn more about reading groups in our documentation.

authorized.title: Oh no. This project doesn’t have any collections yet.
authorized.body: Resource collections are groupings of resources that can be used to orient a reader around certain themes or as a means to place a series of resources onto a text with one insertion.

unauthorized.title: This project doesn’t have any collections yet.

appearance.appearance_reset: Reader color scheme and typography reset to default settings.
appearance.font_size_decreased_min: Reader font size decreased to minimum size.
appearance.font_size_increased_max: Reader font size increased to maximum size.
appearance.margin_size_decreased_min: Reader margins decreased to minimum size.
appearance.margin_size_increased_max: Reader margins increased to maximum size.

messages.empty_journal_body: Add <1>volumes</1> or <3>issues</3> to see this page.
messages.cannot_move_up: Cannot move up. Item is already in the first category.
messages.cannot_move_down: Cannot move down. Item is already in the last category.
messages.content_block_warning_heading: This content block needs your attention before it can be displayed.
messages.content_block_warning_note: Note: This message is only visible to project editors.
messages.unsaved_changes: You may have unsaved changes. Do you want to leave without saving your changes?

category.name: Category name
category.description_instructions: Enter a brief description of the category. This field accepts basic Markdown.

reading_group.name: Group Name
reading_group.privacy_instructions: Annotations in public groups can be viewed by everyone. Annotations in private groups can only be viewed by group members. In anonymous groups, comments are private and only the group creator can see the identity of each annotation's author.
reading_group.invitation_code_instructions: Users can enter the invitation code on the "Manage Reading Groups" page to join this group. You may change this code at any time, but previous codes will no longer work
reading_group.invitation_url_instructions: The URL above is based on the invitation code. Readers can also join the group by visiting this URL.
reading_group.course_instructions: Course information is used for internal tracking and reporting purposes.
reading_group.notifications_instructions: Email me when anyone joins this group

reading_group_member.title: Edit Group Member
reading_group_member.name: Member Name
reading_group_member.role_instructions: Members can see group annotations and annotate within the group. Moderators can manage members and update group settings.
reading_group_member.label: Label
reading_group_member.label_instructions: Labels are used to describe specific members within the group and appear next to the name in the membership list.
reading_group_member.annotation_style_instructions: Annotation styles will appear in the Manifold reading interface and can be used to call differentiate a user's annotations from other annotations in the reading group.
reading_group_member.style_preview: This is what your selected annotation style will look like when viewed in the reader. Font styling and sizing may be different depending on the settings in your visibility control panel.

manage_group.title: Manage Group:
manage_group.instructions: Edit the Home Page or the settings for your Reading Group.

join_group.title: Join a group:
join_group.instructions: To join a group, enter the code and select Join.

duplicate.label: Duplicate
duplicate.heading: Create a copy of {{group}}
duplicate.instructions: This will create a copy of your reading group. Once copied, you will need to add users to the group.

notifications.title: Notification Settings
notifications.instructions: Edit your email notifications and subscriptions.

modals.remove_category_heading: Are you sure you want to remove this category from your collection?
modals.remove_category_body: Any items in this category will also be deleted.
modals.collecting_search: <0>Add content<1>{{heading}}<2>To add content to your Reading Group, search for it by keyword and type, when you have found content you wish to add, select the star icon for that item to add it to your group.

reading_group.homepage_edit_instructions: Organize and edit the contents of your Reading Group’s home page. Search for new content to add. Create your own Categories and add or edit category descriptions. Move content between categories and within content types by dragging with the handle.
reading_group.search_instructions: Search for and star the content you want to add to the home page.
